sentences.en: But researchers are improving systems to measure a teacher’s performance throughout the year, and, with three years of data, it’s usually possible to tell which teachers are failing.

sentences.cn: 不幸的是，芝加哥的工会坚持认为，那些被解雇的教师——常常是因为教学效果差——应在新一轮聘用时被优先考虑。
sentences.en: Unfortunately, the union in Chicago is insisting that teachers who are laid off—often for being ineffective—should get priority in new hiring.

I offer a simple proposition in response: Many of our problems—class attendance, educational success, student happiness and well-being—might be improved by cutting down the bureaucratic ( ' ,  官僚的) mechanisms and meetings and instead hiring an army of good teachers.
